values:
I'm still working as an office assistant for the State, and I've been doing well with that.
Kinda sick at the moment, and truly hoping I feel better soon, as I can't afford to miss much work (I don't have any sick time saved up, so I get docked for any time I miss).
Jacob bought me a promise ring for Christmas (along with some other awesomeness), and I am totally in love with it, and him.
It is an antique ring I saw in this tiny little shop window one night as we were passing by. I pointed it out to him saying it was lovely, and he bought it, and surprised me at Christmas with it. We had to have it resized and shank of the ring and the tips that hold the diamonds on fixed a bit. It cost a ton, but Jacob said, and I quote "You're worth it...and besides...we can pass it down someday"
Can you say D'AWW?!
So, no, it's not an engagement ring (like one of my co-workers thought), but I think that I'm glad it's not...I'm not ready for that. And neither is he. I want to get a better job and we need to move in together, and he wants to go to college. Things are going well right now, I just sometimes forget that as we seem to be stagnating a bit.
He's assistant manager at the Starbucks he works for now, and I have less than 3 months left in my probation period (I'm hoping to become an Office Technician, which starts at 300 more a month to begin with once the probation ends).
I'm also 178, and going down. That means I've lost a total of 72 pounds, and I have less than 30 pounds to my original goal.
I'm not sure if I'm going to be happy once I get there, but we'll see!
I'm happy in general every day now, with minor ups and downs from little bits of stress....But over all, I am happy, content, and loved.
I think the only bit of really sad news I have is that my Grandmother has cancer. They operated on her, and took out the bit of her colon that had the cancer in it, but then they did a test and found out that there is cancer in her lymph nodes as well. She has to have chemotherapy, and I'm scared for her...But I'm hoping that she will end up healthy in the end, and stronger than before.
If you pray, pray for her, and if not, please just keep her in your thoughts now and then.
She believes very heavily in God and Christ, and the power of prayer, and if anyone ever deserved his love, she does.
Okay, I'm off to find some dinner.
I hope all of you are well :)

I don't have internet on my computer, so there's no updating with photos, but there are words!

I'm still an Office Assistant, and while I'm making money, it's not enough to live on my own. So, I continue to live with Jacob, which is actually working out well.
We're seeing a counselor and she's helped us tremendously with our issues with the relationship, and within ourselves, especially mine, and how Jacob deals, or doesn't deal, with them.
I feel more grown up every day, which is very odd.
Then again, I will be 23 in less than 3 months. Weirdddd.

I want a better paying job, but then again, I know it won't happen over night. So for now, I pass my probation in 4 months, then see what happens :)

I'm losing weight, but it's VERY slow going. I'm around 182 now, with a goal of 150 by July next year. I go to 24 hour fitness probably 2-3 times weekly, and want to get a rowing machine, or something like that, for home. I also want a heart monitor, but those things will have to wait until after Christmas, and my next pay check....haha.

I'm doing some extra work for the State, some workers rights flyers that needed editing and redesigning, so at least there's that! That's over time, which is only like, 134 for 11 hours, because they tax so god damn much, but it's something extra at least.

I'm excited that Christmas is near, but I also know that I can't send out my gifts soon enough. Those of you who know you're getting gifts from me, we'll just have to meet up in person, kay? <3 LOVES!!!

Okay, off to wrap Jacob's present!
I can't get to LJ from work, it's blocked, so if any of you want to talk to me while I'm at work, just email me there okay?

awells@dir.ca.gov

Love love love!!!!

Working for the state,
working on my figure,
working on MYSELF,
and my relationship.

Things are okay...but hopefully they're going to get even better.

Started work today, and everything is going absolutely amazing!
I'm really happy about the work, and about the people I'm going to be working with.
I'm picking up everything really quickly and one of the student assistants said that two of the higher ups
were talking about me. Bragging actually haha.
"She's so neat! She's so nice!"

Hehe...funny and good times :D

I have a job that starts on Wednesday. I'm going to be an office assistant (well, public records request person) for the state. I have a stable job that has security, and medical and dental benefits. I am going to be so happy with this, because it means I only have 8-5 from Monday to Friday to work....and then I can work on whatever I want after that. 

I can keep my awesome part time job with Willo, and anything else I want to. 

Hurray! :D

I'm going to be living with Jacob for a bit...But I'm going to start looking for a room in about a month or so.

Hurray!

Not that many of you were gonna show up anyway, but I think I have a small part time job thingy going on in the bay are, so this week I'm gonna have to stay down there more than I'd like.

Could always road trip and see me down in the bay though too :D

Again.
I was really hopeful about this one too.
The design shop never even called. Not even to say "sorry, but no"
....I hate this feeling of failure.
I finished college....
Isn't it supposed to be easier now?

-sigh-

My body kinda hurts from working out two days in a row, but I'm also tired because I haven't been sleeping well lately...I don't really know why and it's beginning to bother me.
I also don't know what's going on with Jacob anymore.
I love him, and I'm in love with him...but right now.... I don't know what to do, or how to act around him.
It's really really confusing, like my world is kinda tipped on end.
Everything I'm working towards right now doesn't seem to have any long term goals.
Why am I getting a job, other than to pay back my loans? What's the end result?
I want a family, a career, stability and happiness, but none of that seems possible at the moment with everything held on by a simple, invisible, and fraying thread.
This could also possibly just be a reaction due to my body kicking off endorphins and such, but I don't think so.
I'm also annoyed that things aren't working out the way I want...

But  I think I'll just have to deal.
And hope I get that job, so my life has some sort of meaning again.

No, not tomorrow, but the wednesday after that.
10pm, not midnight.
J street Denny's.
Bring whoever you want, just show up!
I'ma missing people!


p.s.
Jacob is an ass.
I don't have a lisp.
Jerk.

2nd interview went just as well, should know by Friday, they said.
Here's hoping :)

2nd interview with that Sign company here in Sacramento (really Folsom)

Maybe I'll get it, and finally have a job.
Shweet.
Here's hoping

http://kevan.org/johari?name=Adrias_silver


Also, I'm currently at Cassie's, hanging out with Erica. We're gonna go swimming today, and go see this guy named Galen who has a few snakes, a gecko, and a millipede :D

I get to hang out until tomorrow morning. -dance- Hurray!

Hi Adria,
 
Although I'm impressed with your work, I'm sorry that I will need to choose someone else for the position.  We received many well qualified applicants so it was difficult to choose.  In the end we chose this particular applicant because he had extensive 3dStudio experience.
But I have your resume, and when another opportunity comes up, I will keep you mind.  Thank you for your time in coming down to interview with us.
 
Waibun


In other words: No.

Did my first workout today.
Was advised by the lady at Curves to not go below 20% body fat, so that's my new goal.
150lbs and 20% body fat.....Or whatever comes first really...

Size 8/10 here I come!

I once hit 175, and I'm back stuck at 185.

Those ten pounds taunt me.

I know that 150 is the ultimate goal, yeah, but right now 175 seems even harder, maybe because it's so close.
Anyway.
Gonna join curves again, and force myself to start back on the good eating-good exercising-band wagon.
No more slacking off!

that's the website of the place I just went and interviewed at for a Graphics position.

Will be really really cool if I get the job, but the guy who interviewed me still has a whole stack of applications to go through before the end of the week. 

Interview went well, and I think he and I connected enough that he got to know my personality a little bit, but, once again, whole stack of applicants before friday.

He said he'd call early next week.
Here's to hoping!

And I've been looking furiously.
Now one is emailing me back, and I'm too shy/afraid to cold call, or even follow up call. I know I have to, I just feel so weird!!! What if they haven't gotten to my resume yet? Or just laughed outright at it?

Bleh.


Oh, and Danielle's done absolutely nothing for me, other than refer me to the Creative Group, who also, haven't done anything for me.

I'm fucking PISSED.

My Grandmother decided to sell me her Honda Accord. It's a 1998, and 110k miles. It has AIR CONDITIONING...but lacks a cd player. Ah well. :D

4,000 dollars... and I'll be paying slowly over the years. Hurray!

Sitting in front of my computer, I'm going to be online all day, crunching away all the information on photoshop and indesign I can before tomorrow's assessment test.

Wtf, I thought finals were over?!

We'll start at 11:30 at J street Denny's, and continue on until whenever.
Invite whoever you want, and I'll see you all there!
call me if you need anything!

-dances about-

I was wrong on the date! I got home last night, not tonight!
Hurray for being home a whole day early! :D

So I'm coming back on the 16th, and I've been looking online at the job prospects...and kinda cringing.

If you have ANY leads for me on a possible job (I'm hoping for bay area, but we'll see), please DON'T HESITATE!
Send me links, or comment them here...Give my website to people (http://adriawells.com) or my phone number or email.

I'm really looking forward to finding a good job I won't be horrible at, that I can contribute to the success of the company, if only in a minor way.
oh, and I don't really want to live with my parents for long, k'thx.
:D

I'll be back the 16th of August, around 9:30, at the Sac airport.
I don't know what's going on for the next 4-5 days after I get back, so we'll have to play it by ear.
I plan on spending at least 2 of those days in Sacramento, so perhaps one of those nights we can all get a denny's group going.
The rest of the time might be spent in the bay area, with those friends and Jacob.

We'll see.

Excited to be coming home soon :)

Left in Europe.
This has been one of, if not the most influencial and mind-opening experiences of my life.
I've learned a lot, felt a lot, and grown so much just from the sights around me, the things I've visited and seen, and the people I've witnessed, talked to, or avoided.
Not to mention how I've expanded on thought about my own life once I get home.
Things are gonna be good...
They're gonna be amazing.

Looking forward to seeing all of you.
Love!

Got back from Rome last night.
Spent 3 days in Florence and 3 in Rome.
Can't believe how amazing (and amazingly HOT) Italy was.
I'm so damn tired still though...and homesick.

Maybe when I get back, we can all get together for a mini-welcome back, mostly just because I miss you guys something FIERCE!

AND

I wanna have my own celebration for Cassie's birthday.
Which is in T-minus 4 days my time mind you!!!

LOVE!

I'm tired and sore, but still deliriously happy with how the trip went. Alysha and I saw SO much in the 6 days we were there...It'll be a huge massive post..But I just don't know if I'll ever get around to it honestly... I'd rather tell the stories in person, and I won't be seeing any of you for something like 35 days. (yes I'm counting)

I miss you all so much. My family, friends...my boyfriend.
Jacob and I had a minor fight which was quickly solved by talking right before I went to Paris, and I've been okay without speaking to him more than a few times since then. We did have a silly/cute text exchange which some of you (i.e. Cassie) would find funny.

Me: I'm in the Louvre. I think I'm gonna cry.

Jacob: Beautiful?

Me: Beyond my wildest dreams.

Jacob: Good. Now stop texting before you end up owing the phone company our first born child. I love you.


Hehe. Sorry, just had a rocky start what with being apart for a month and a half. Now it's all good. 

Paris is dirty, the people can be rude, and NO ONE knows what personal space is. Oh, and it's not rude to stare.
I wish for Paris' beauty, with America's politeness (at least where I'm from anyway)

Alright, time for shower and then some downloading of pictures. I took over a 1000...hahaha.

Pics :D

http://www.flickr.com/photos/38978698@N00/675227549/

Just click the kitty and keep going for about 8 pictures. The last one is of Colt (lil blonde boy) sliding down a slide with his mouth open.

The rest are from graduation, etc,.

I am celebrating my one year anniversary with Jacob (he said he's counting the month and 10 days we were broken up anyway.) by babysitting two adorable kids in Germany. I'll post pictures of them later on tonight. Their names are Ronan (7) and Miranda (4) and they're so sweet.

Alright, back to babysitting. Zathura awaits. :)


p.s. I love my honey :D

Germany is awesome. Alysha and I made a new friend here already, I took 598 pictures on the new camera so far (plus 7 videos) and that didn't even fill up the 2gig sd card I have.
Today isn't as dark and gloomy as yesterday, so we might venture out to a park nearby with the munchkins in tow. Hurray for vacations! :D

Alysha and I landed this morning around 9:05 Germany time (somewhere after midnight according to my Father when I called him to let him know we got here okay)

Tonya and her husband came and got us, and we're now located at their home in Kaiserslaughtern. We have the guest room, internet access whenever we want, and phone priviledges (it's supposedly super cheap to call. I'm happy with this :)

I got on the plane this morning after saying goodbye to my crying Mother and my somber boyfriend (who kept telling me it would be okay as I teared up). Alysha and I were on and off planes all day, running to the next one thinking we were late, only to find out that it was delayed. We eventually made our way onto the plane that would fly from Philadelphia all the way to Frankfurt, Germany. The stewardess started us off great, "please stay seated, the plane could break at any time...." Of course, she meant the plane could brake (STOP MOVING) at any time on the runway while we were waiting for our turn to take off...But nonetheless it got a titter of laughter out of the tired/nervous/annoyed passengers.

By this time, my whole body ached, my feet were swollen, and I'd cried a few times. I'm going to be gone for a month and a half, without any contact with anyone but the net and the phone. I thought I would have even less contact than I now know I'll have.
I'm much less concerned now....but about 6 hours into the Philly~>Frankfurt flight, in the middle of "Catch and Release" while Alysha snored next to me...I couldn't help but cry a bit.

The movie was incredibly sad. It was about a woman who's fiance' died...and all I can think about at that moment is "Will I see him again?"
And of course it's a silly little thought...But the intensity of the emotion that coursed through my veins at that second denied all logic, and thus, tears. But they were releasing. I was able to cry, and then be done with it, and take tons more pictures of the gorgeous sky spreading out across the horizon.

I'll have to upload the pictures when I get home...Because for now it's just too much going on all around. We're babysitting Miranda, Tonya and Michael's youngest. She'll be 5 in April (and is darn adorable). Tonya just left to go back to Boy Scouts where their other child, Ronan is. 

I'm just happy to be here, but I also know that late at night, I'm gonna miss Jacob. But I think a month and half without me around might give him some perspective about moving out, about me, about life in general. I know I'm going to need it.

My world has changed so much in the past month. From enemies to friends back to something in between, from pre-grad to grad and now to jobless vacationing bum, from unsure to sure to heart throbbing.

I've got tons to think about, even more to do, and a billion and one places to take pictures of.
See you later :)

As of the 28th of this month, I will be in Europe.

As such, my phone will be off limits.

Please, do NOT call or text me while I'm in Europe.

It will cost an arm and a leg, and while this is sad, I won't be able to afford 100 dollar calls :)

So, if you want to get in contact with me, just email me. I'll be checking my email periodically, and I should be able to respond weekly, or even more depending on where we are.

Thanks!!!

~Adria

I've settled in a bit into my parent's house again, and finally set up my desk in the den once more.
I can take a breather and upload some photos and make a real post about my last week.

Let's start back at the beginning.

I finished up my reel with maybe a second to spare, burned the dvds, printed the portfolio, dvd labels and covers, and put everything together just in time to show up for the portfolio show. The roses were finished thanks to Justine and Jacob's help, and I managed to look pretty good in my spiffed up portfolio show wear. Didn't get anyone interested really, but my adviser brought over someone from Lucasfilm and I managed to send them an updated portfolio link today. I'm hoping to get a reply, but I'm not that optimistic.

It's funny, from thursday to saturday night, I didn't realize how much I was loved until I look back on it now.
So many people came out to my portfolio show (thank you Brad, Robert, Justine and everyone else) that didn't have to, but did. 
SOoooo many people showed up for my graduation, and I cried probably half a dozen times that day, just because I knew how much I was loved, in that very moment.
And because it's all over. I'm done with that phase in my life.
No more homework. Everything I do now, I do for myself, to get a job.

Graduation was amazing, and the party afterwards was evening more fun. I just loved having one final pig out before going back on my diet (my sister and I are walking everyday and eating better now too, thank god.) 

Here's a few pictures of everyone at the show, the graduation and the afterparty.
Heheh, I'm so happy :)
http://www.flickr.com/photos/38978698@N00/sets/72157600413061369/show/

Blaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhh..

Yeah. That's about how I feel. -zonks out-

For serious this time. Like, walked the stage and had my entire freaking family YELLING at me, plus Jacob, his Mom, and Cassie.
I am beyond happy.....


And oh so relieved. -breathes a gentle sigh-

Okay, time to pack. Moving tomorrow -busy yet again-

It's tuesday.
I have tonight, tomorrow and thursday morning to finish up my reel, my portfolio, and print everything and burn everything.
I have all these tiny things to take care of that just seem to be taking forever...

But, Thursday is the portfolio show.
And Friday I graduate.
Graduate.
I don't think it's hit me yet....

Patience I don't currently have.
Man, I have to re-render 4 turn arounds because they were crap the first time.
Dammit.

OH, and I've been researching point and shoots, because I desperately want to buy myself a new camera for the Europe trip. I'm thinking 200 is my limit. What say you guys? Any favs among you?

Thursday is the portfolio show. I'm so fucking close I can taste it.
I have to move on saturday, and friday is the actual graduation ceremony...
Tomorrow I have to go see my career advisor about the stupid check off sheet, and I have a project I still have to send to a group for belief systems tonight.
I'm SO hating this. I'm hating that people keep saying 'but you're done right? you can relax right?"
no...no guys, not so much.

-explode-

A grande lite caramel frappuccino
Black cheery yogurt
Egg salad sandwich
and about half a gallon of water.

So, I'm graduating. At least, I'm planning on it.
So my Mom is holding this party in Sacramento at their place for me, and anyone who's in the vicinity and wants to go is invited.
Just email me at Adriawells@yahoo.com for the address.

It's on the 24th of June from Noon till 5pm.
Bring food and drinks if you want, and games as well.
Most likely just gonna be a huge socializing event thing, so come if you want to hang out with me and my nutty family and friends.

<3

• Figure out origami roses, once and for all :\ (I'm lame and can't follow tutorials)
  • Finish white room
  • Finish Kayla
  • Finish Amaya

I'm lying in Jacob's bed right now, curled up with some of the worst cramps so far this year. Not so bad I'm crying or can't move without whining, but bad enough that I'm nauseous and upset at the world, but mostly upset at my uterus.
Jacob is hanging out at John's house with John and Kevvy, because Kevvy's back for only a little bit.
I told him to go, even after he offered to stay and rub my tummy for me, but I kinda wish I hadn't. I'm in pain, but I can deal with it. I just sometimes feel like being a wuss, and being selfish. But he rarely sees Kevvy, and they're best buds.

So, I'm here, just thinking in the quasi-dark, about my life, and where it stands.
The cramps are probably making me pessimistic, but I'm worried about graduation as usual. I know I'll manage it. Just have to crack down, once more, and get my list done by this weekend, and my Grammy's garden party on Saturday.
Gonna see Cass that night , hopefully.

I don't know what's going to happen after I graduate. I want to stay in the bay area, but I know I have to move back up to my rents' place for at least a little while. Until I can find a job that makes it possible to live on my own, PLUS pay for all my loans. Something like 800 a month I think.
Need to talk to my Mom about consolidation too..

I guess this entry is just random, because that's where I am right now. Just kinda floating around in my own head.
Thoughts about tomorrow, yesterday, things that haven't happened yet, and things that could have been.
I've been really weird lately, and I don't really know why, but it scares me sometimes, thinking that this mood won't pass. It's not depression in the classic sense..Just an odd odd mood. Likely, overwhelming sense of having lost myself, and in losing me, losing all around me. But then again, it could just be my imagination.
Never you mind me.
I think I just need some sleep.
And luckily, I am pretty darn tired.
Night.

Man, stupid people and not researching shit.
I hate when I get mad at people for dumb stuff. It annoys me that I can sit here and get so mad at someone I love because of misunderstandings.
GAH.
All over movie times. -frustrations-
